    "14 ) while the corresponding @xmath64 is equal to @xmath441 or @xmath442 for the right and left turning point respectively ( see ( 4 ) ) i.e. @xmath443 , so that @xmath444 .",
    "we name the quantity @xmath449 the _ generalized separatrix split _ ( gss ) for the lower layer . unlike the conventional separatrix split @xmath170 @xcite ,",
    "it is _ angle - dependent_. the curve @xmath450 may be called then the gss curve for the lower barrier and denoted as @xmath451 .",
    "finally , let us investigate an important issue : whether the transformation from the discrete separatrix map ( i.e. ( a13 ) and ( a14 ) ) to the differential equations ( a15 ) is valid for the very first step and , if it is so , for how long it is valid after that . the transformation is valid as long as @xmath452 i.e. as long as @xmath453 is not too close to the barrier energy @xmath11 . at the step @xmath454",
    ", the system stays at the gss curve , with a given ( random ) angle @xmath455 from the range ( a18 ) .",
    "thus , at this stage , the relation ( a7 ) is certainly valid ( for the relevant range of @xmath14 and for an angle a little away from the narrow vicinity of the multiples of @xmath127 ) .",
    "hence , ( a7 ) is valid at the step @xmath457 too .",
    "similarly , one can show that @xmath458 , etc .",
    "thus , the transformation ( a13,a14)@xmath459(a15 ) is valid at this initial stage indeed , and the evolution of @xmath437 does reduce to the resonant trajectory ( 14 ) with an initial angle from the range ( a18 ) and the initial action ( a19 ) .",
    "this lasts until the resonant trajectory meets the gss curve in the adjacent @xmath127 range of @xmath120 i.e. at @xmath460 such that the state @xmath461 satisfies the conditions :      at this instant , the absolute value of the change of energy @xmath453 in the separatrix map ( a13 ) is equal to @xmath463 ( just because the state belongs to the gss curve ) but the sign of this change is negative since the sign of @xmath464 is opposite to the sign of @xmath465 .",
    "therefore , at the step @xmath466 , the system gets to the very separatrix , and the regular - like evolution stops : at the next step of the map , the system may either again get to the gss curve with a new ( random ) angle from the range ( a18 ) and start a new regular - like evolution as described above ; or it may get to the similar gss curve _ below _ the barrier and start an analogous regular - like evolution in the energy range below the barrier , until it stops in the same manner as described above , etc .",
    "this approach makes it possible to describe all features of the transport within the chaotic layer .",
    "their detailed description will be done elsewhere while , in the present context , it is most important to describe the _ upper outer boundary _ of the layer .",
    "it follows from the analysis carried out in the previous subsection that _ any _ state ( in the @xmath467 plane ) lying beyond the gss curve but belonging to any trajectory following the equations ( 14 ) which possesses common points with the gss curve belongs to the chaotic layer : the system starting from such a state will get , sooner or later , to the separatrix , where the chaotization will necessarily occur .",
    "therefore , the _ upper boundary _ of the chaotic layer coincides with the trajectory following the equations ( 14 ) with the initial action ( a19 ) and an initial angle @xmath468 from the range ( a18 ) such that the trajectory deviates from the barrier energy more than a trajectory ( 14)-(a18)-(a19 ) with any other initial angle does",
    ". there may be only two topologically different options for such a trajectory : either it is the trajectory _",
    "tangent _ to the gss curve , or it is the separatrix trajectory which _ intersects _ the gss curve ( some schematic examples are shown in figs .",
    "16(a ) and 16(b ) respectively ; some real calculations are shown in figs .",
    "8 and 9 ) .",
    "consider first values of @xmath14 which are large enough for the condition ( a7 ) to be satisfied ( the explicit criterion will be given in ( a31 ) ) but which are smaller than the value @xmath469 determined by eq .",
    "( 41 ) ( its meaning is explained below ) .",
    "the further analysis within this range of @xmath14 differs for the ranges of @xmath15 relevant to _ odd _ and _ even _ spikes , and we consider them separately .",
    "let us seek the state @xmath471 ( with @xmath169 within the range @xmath1110,\\pi[$ ] ) where the resonant trajectory curve is _ tangent _ to the gss curve . with this aim , we equal both the actions and the derivatives of both curves . the equality of actions immediately yields @xmath472 via @xmath169 : @xmath473 .",

    "we obtain a closed equation for @xmath169 , and its solution immediately gives us the relevant @xmath455 :    @xmath475_{e = e_t^{(l)}}=0 , \\\\ & & e_t^{(l)}\\equiv e_b^{(1)}+h|\\epsilon^{(low)}|\\sin(\\tilde{\\psi}_{t}^{(l ) } ) , \\nonumber\\\\ & & \\tilde{\\psi}_{t}^{(l)}\\in [ 0,\\pi ] ,   \\quad\\quad n\\equiv 2j-1 , \\quad\\quad j=1,3,5,\\ldots , \\nonumber \\\\ & & \\tilde{\\psi}(0)=\\tilde{\\psi}_{t}^{(l)}. \\nonumber\\end{aligned}\\ ] ]    a careful analysis of the phase space structure shows that , in the present case ( i.e. when @xmath476 while @xmath254 is odd ) , there is no separatrix of the resonant hamiltonian ( 4 ) which would both intersect the gss curve and possess points above the tangent trajectory @xcite .",
    "thus , for this range of @xmath14 , the outer boundary of the chaotic layer is formed by the trajectory following the dynamical equations ( 14 ) with the initial angle by ( a22 ) and initial action ( a19 ) ( fig .",

    "so , eq . ( a36 ) implies , in the asymptotic limit , that the right - hand side equals zero . expressing @xmath14 via @xmath521 from eq .",
    "( a34 ) , we finally obtain a closed transcendental equation for @xmath522 :              thus , we have proved the following asymptotic properties of the separatrix generated by the saddle @xmath279  : 1 ) the lower whiskers of the separatrix do intersect the gss curve in the relevant range of @xmath10 ( i.e. where the resonant approximation is valid ) , 2 ) the upper whiskers of the separatrix do _ not _ intersect the gss curve ( there is no solution of eq .",
    "( a36 ) in the range @xmath527 ) .",
    "the former property confirms the self - consistence of the asymptotic theory for even spikes ; the latter property means that the _ upper outer boundary _ of the lower chaotic layer is formed by the _",
    "upper whiskers of the separatrix generated by the saddle @xmath279_.              as @xmath14 grows , the boundary of the layer raises up while the lower part of the resonance separatrix , on the contrary , goes down .",
    "they reconnect at the critical value of @xmath14 , @xmath529 , determined by eq .",
    "( 41 ) , that may be considered as the absorption of the resonance by the chaotic layer .",
    "if @xmath14 grows further , then the gss curve and the resonance separatrix intersect . as a result , the trajectory starting from the state with the angle ( a22 ) and action ( a19 ) , for odd spikes , or from the saddle @xmath279 , for even spikes , is _ encompassed _ by the resonance separatrix .",
    "so , it does not form the outer boundary of the layer anymore .",
    "rather it forms the inner boundary i.e. the boundary of the main island of the stability inside the layer , repeated periodically in @xmath120 with a period @xmath119 ( cf .",
    "analogous islands in the upper layer in fig . 8) . unless the lower chaotic layer reconnects with the upper one , the _ outer _ boundary of the lower layer is formed by the upper part of the _ resonance separatrix_. the relevant initial angle @xmath455 on the gss curve corresponds to the intersection of the gss curve with the resonance separatrix ( cf .",
    "the analogous situation for the upper layer in fig . 8) .",
    "similarly to the lower - layer case , one may consider the ranges of relatively small @xmath14 ( namely , smaller than @xmath530 determined by eq .",
    "( 42 ) ) and relatively large @xmath14 ( i.e. @xmath531 ) . in the former range ,",
    "the formation of the boundary occurs in a manner which is , in a sense , opposite to that for the lower - layer case . for even spikes ,",
    "the lower outer boundary is formed by _ tangency _ while , for odd spikes , it is formed by the lower part of the _ separatrix _ generated by the saddle @xmath278 , analogous to the saddle @xmath279 in the lower - layer case @xcite .",
    "@xmath532_{e = e_t^{(u)}}=0 , \\\\ & & e_t^{(u)}\\equiv e_b^{(2)}-h|\\epsilon^{(up)}|\\sin(\\tilde{\\psi}_{t}^{(u)})\\nonumber \\\\ & & \\tilde{\\psi}_{t}^{(u)}\\in\\left[0,\\pi \\right ] , \\quad\\quad n\\equiv 2j-1 , \\quad\\quad j=2,4,6,\\ldots , \\nonumber \\\\ & & \\tilde{\\psi}(0)=\\tilde{\\psi}_{t}^{(u)},\\nonumber\\end{aligned}\\ ] ]            where @xmath535 is the time dependence of the velocity along the separatrix associated with the upper barrier and the instant @xmath393 is chosen so that @xmath536 is equal to the coordinate of the lower barrier while @xmath537 for @xmath538 . the dependence @xmath539 in eq .",

    "( 33 ) while the deviation of its energy from the barrier is approximated , to the lowest - order approximation , by eq .",
    "( 34 ) .",
    "as @xmath14 grows , the boundary of the layer goes down while the upper part of the upper resonance separatrix goes up .",
    "they reconnect at @xmath547 , as determined by eq .",
    "( 42 ) , that may be considered as the absorption of the resonance by the chaotic layer .    for larger @xmath14",
    ", the boundary of the layer is formed by the lower part of the upper resonance separatrix ( fig . 8) , unless the latter intersects the lower gss curve ( in the latter case , @xmath548 marks the global chaos onset ) .",

    "morozov , chaos * 12 * , 539 ( 2002 ) .",

    "yevtushenko , and r. mannella , in _ noise in complex systems and stochastic dynamics ii _ , eds . z. gingl , j.m .",
    "sancho , l. schimansky - geier , j. kertesz , proceedings of spie vol .",
    "5471 ( spie , bellingham , wa , 2004 ) p. 355 .",
    "this value of @xmath14 is so close to the critical value @xmath33 ( the latter is about 0.0049 , as seen from fig .",
    "4 ) that the blue and green layers nearly touch each other .",
    "that is why we did not draw a regular trajectory separating the layers .",
    "we still use different colours for the trajectories starting from @xmath549 and @xmath550 in order to demonstrate that their mixing occurs very slowly , which indicates that @xmath14 is only slightly above the critical @xmath33 .            for sufficiently small @xmath61 and @xmath14 , the separatrix generated by the unstable point forms the boundary of the upper chaotic layer , but this affects only the higher - order terms in the expressions for the spikes minima ( see below ) .",
    "( 20 ) is the _ sufficient _ ( rather than only necessary ) condition for the separatrix reconnection since there is no any other separatrix which would lie in between the separatrices generated by the saddles  and  .        with account for the next - order corrections",
    ", the spike minimum @xmath221 coincides with @xmath219 in case of an odd spike or with @xmath220 in case of an even spike .",
    "this occurs because , in case of odd spikes , @xmath553 increases / decreases as @xmath10 approaches the relevant vicinity of the upper / lower barrier , while it is vice versa in case of even spikes . and",
    "the larger @xmath112 the farer the resonance separatrix extends : in other words , the reconnection of the barrier chaotic layer with the resonance separatrix requires a smaller value of @xmath14 at the barrier where @xmath112 , in the relevant vicinity of the barrier , is larger .    for a given @xmath55 ,",
    "the numerical error on @xmath33 is rather large since the corresponding simulation involves a very long integration time .",
    "we estimate the relative numerical error of @xmath554 to be @xmath555 .",
    "note however that this error practically does not affect the measured values of the frequencies @xmath60 in the minima of the spikes : the error in the measurement of @xmath33 is systematic while the spikes are very sharp .",
    "we estimate the error of @xmath556 to be @xmath557 .",
    "still , this procedure does not pretend to be exaustive since it takes into account only corrections within the description by means of the resonant hamiltonian ( 4 ) , while ignoring a correction to the resonant hamiltonian ( 4 ) itself .",
    "a derivation of the latter correction requires the use of the second - order averaging method @xcite , that goes beyond the scope of the present paper . on the other hand",
    ", even our incomplete procedure gives a good agreement with the simulations .",
    "it means that the corrections coming from the second - order averaging are probably insignificant in comparison with the corrections of other origins .",
    "obviously , this motion is necessarily three - dimensional .",
    "however , if the direction of the magnetic field is perpendicular to the direction of its periodicity , then the motion in the plane perpendicular to the magnetic filed is _ separated _ from the motion along the field .",
    "thus , the in - plane dynamics is two - dimensional while being reduced in the relevant case to the one - dimensional dynamics ( 2)-(1 ) ( cf .",
    "@xcite ) .",
    "spikes correspond to the motion over any of the minima of the potential , first in one and then ( after the reflection from one of the upper barriers ) in the opposite direction .",
    "if @xmath61 is small , the spikes within the pulse are separated by a long interval since the reflection point is situated close to the top of the upper barrier , where the motion is slow .",
    "the latter is valid for any @xmath403 except in the close vicinity of multiples of @xmath127 while the state @xmath558 ( a5 ) in the latter range of @xmath403 turns out irrelevant to the boundary , as shown further down .",
    "for odd numbers @xmath559 , there are separatrices which lie in the range of @xmath10 where @xmath560 i.e. much closer to the barrier than the tangent trajectory : these separatrices are therefore irrelevant .      in case of a _ moderately _ small @xmath61 , they may intersect the gss curve . and then , the tangent trajectory lying above the separatrix necessarily exists , so that the boundary of the layer is formed by this tangent trajectory .    for any",
    "ac - driven spatially periodic hamiltonian system , the _ upper _ energy boundary of the layer associated with the unbounded separatrix diverges in the adiabatic limit @xmath380 @xcite .",
    "however , this divergence is not relevant for the present problem for the following reasons .",
    "the lower chaotic layer relates to the _ bounded _ separatrix while , for the upper ( unbounded ) layer , it is the _ lower _ boundary of the layer which is relevant for the onset of global chaos in between the separatrices .",
    "moreover , even for the upper boundary of the upper layer , the divergence is not yet manifested for the driving parameters @xmath561 in the vicinity of the spikes minima ( cf ."
  ],
  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> we have developed the _ general method _ for the description of _ separatrix chaos _ , basing on the analysis of the separatrix map dynamics . matching it with the resonant hamiltonian analysis , </S>",
    "<S> we show that , for a given amplitude of perturbation , the maximum width of the chaotic layer in energy may be much larger than it was assumed before . </S>",
    "<S> we apply the above theory to explain the drastic facilitation of global chaos onset in time - periodically perturbed hamiltonian systems possessing two or more separatrices , previously discovered ( prl 90 , 174101 ( 2003 ) ) . </S>",
    "<S> the theory well agrees with simulations . </S>",
    "<S> we also discuss generalizations and applications . </S>",
    "<S> examples of applications of the facilitation include : the increase of the dc conductivity in spatially periodic structures , the reduction of activation barriers for noise - induced transitions and the related acceleration of spatial diffusion , the facilitation of the stochastic web formation in a wave - driven or kicked oscillator . </S>"
  ]
}
